name.description: The name of the service instance

user.description: The user that the service will run as.

service_account.description: The service account for DC/OS service authentication. This is typically left empty to use the default unless service authentication is needed. The value given here is passed as the principal of the Mesos framework.

service_account_secret.description: Name of the Secret Store credentials to use for DC/OS service authentication. This should be left empty unless service authentication is needed.

log_level.description: The log level for the DC/OS service.

region.description: The region that the service's tasks should run in.

sleep.description: The sleep duration in seconds before tasks exit.

test_boolean.description: A boolean value for testing purposes

test_profile_volume_command.description: A shell command to test if a given path is on a profile volume, or empty for no test

scenario.description: A comma-separated list of SDK customization scenarios to perform on the service(s)

yaml.description: A single example YAML file to deploy, or an empty string to launch an empty multi-scheduler

yamls.description: A comma-separated list of example YAML files to deploy in a multi-scheduler, in addition to any listed in 'yaml'

custom_service_tld.description: Specifies a custom TLD to use for endpoints

constraints.description: Placement constraint for the hello-world scheduler

verbose_mesos_logging.description: Sets the value of GLOG_v env-var used by Mesos. Enabled by default, set to 0 to disable.

check.description: Checks are a way to understand the health of a service. These HTTP checks are intended to be consumed by services external to Mesos/Marathon which will take appropriate action on them.

intervalSeconds.description: Number of seconds to wait between checks

timeoutSeconds.description: Number of seconds after which a check times out, regardless of the response. This value must be smaller than intervalSeconds

delaySeconds.description: Amount of time to wait until starting the checks

debug.description: Config to start the scheduler with remote debug options enabled. THIS SHOULD NOT HAVE ANY DEFAULTS

suspend.description: Suspend the JVM until a debugger is attached

address.description: Interface to listen. This is a string to support *:6242 style to bind to all interfaces

disk.description: Hello pod persistent disk requirements (in MB)

volume_profile.description: Hello pod persistent volume profile requirements

count.description: Number of Hello pods to run

kill_grace_period.description: The number of seconds of grace to await a clean shutdown following SIGTERM before sending SIGKILL, default: `0`

port_one.description: any arbitrary port can be used

seccomp-unconfined.description: unconfined from the default seccomp profile

seccomp-profile-name.description: seccomp profile to run pod with

rlimits.description: POSIX resource limits applied to the pod. Excercise caution when modifying these default values as it can lead to spurious task failures.

rlimit_nofile.description: Specifies RLIMIT_NOFILE, a value one greater than the maximum file descriptor number that can be opened by this process.

soft.description: The  soft  limit  is  the  value that the kernel enforces for the corresponding resource.

hard.description: The  hard  limit  acts as a ceiling for the soft limit.

disk.description: World pod persistent disk requirements (in MB)

count.description: Number of World pods to run

kill_grace_period.description: The number of seconds of grace to await a clean shutdown following SIGTERM before sending SIGKILL, default: `0`

readiness_check.description: Readiness check settings. Excercise caution when modifying these default values as it can lead to spurious task failures.

interval.description: The period in seconds to wait after the last readiness check has completed to start the next check.

delay.description: An amount of time in seconds to wait before starting the readiness check attempts.

timeout.description: An amount of time in seconds to wait for a readiness check to succeed.

rlimits.description: POSIX resource limits applied to the pod. Excercise caution when modifying these default values as it can lead to spurious task failures.

rlimit_nofile.description: Specifies RLIMIT_NOFILE, a value one greater than the maximum file descriptor number that can be opened by this process.

soft.description: The  soft  limit  is  the  value that the kernel enforces for the corresponding resource.

hard.description: The  hard  limit  acts as a ceiling for the soft limit.

discovery_task_prefix.description: Service discovery prefix name for discovery task
